docs.title: 🎯 What is this API for ?
docs.text: Welcome to the API documentation for the E-commerce Chatbot Assistant. This API allows you to integrate a conversational AI assistant into your e-commerce application. It can handle customer service requests, provide order-related information, and offer personalized product recommendations — all through natural language.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• An API key (get one from your dashboard)
  • An HTTP-capable frontend or backend

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
All endpoints require authentication via API key in the Authorization header :

Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY
  • Format: Bearer Token
  • Lifetime: 24h (configurable)

docs.title: Quickstart
docs.text:
curl -X POST https://api.chatbot.ai/v1/chat \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer sk-123..." \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"message": "Where is my order?"}'

Expected response:

{ "reply": "Your order ORD-789 is on the way!" }

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: To use the E-commerce Chatbot API, all requests must be authenticated using an API key or OAuth 2.0.

docs.title: Sending an API Key
docs.text:
You must include your API key in the Authorization header of each request:

Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

docs.title: Example (cURL)
docs.text:
curl -X POST https://api.example.com/api/v1/chat/send \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer sk_test_your_api_key" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
        "message": "I need help with my order",
        "user_id": "user_123"
      }'

docs.title: 🔐 OAuth 2.0 (Advanced Auth)
docs.text:
Optional — for apps with multiple users or needing delegated access.

  1. Obtain a client ID and secret from the developer dashboard.
  2. Implement the OAuth 2.0 flow (authorization code grant or client credentials).
  3. Use the returned access token as a Bearer token in the Authorization header.

docs.title: Example Header with OAuth Token
docs.text: Authorization: Bearer ya29.a0ARrdaM9XYZabcToken

docs.title: 🚫 Common Errors
docs.text: Error Code Message Explanation 401 Unauthorized Missing or invalid token/API key 403 Forbidden Token is valid but lacks required permissions 429 Too Many Requests Rate limit exceeded

docs.title: 🧪 Tips
docs.text:
• Never expose your API keys in frontend apps.
  • Rotate API keys periodically.
  • Use OAuth if you need to access the API on behalf of end users.

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text: The API uses standard HTTP status codes and structured error responses to help you diagnose and resolve issues quickly.

docs.title: ⚠️ HTTP Status Codes
docs.text: Code Meaning When it Occurs 200 OK Successful request 400 Bad Request Missing or invalid parameters 401 Unauthorized Missing or invalid API key or token 403 Forbidden Access denied to resource 404 Not Found Invalid endpoint or resource 429 Too Many Requests Rate limit exceeded 500 Internal Server Error Unexpected error on the server

docs.title: 🔁 Common Error Responses
docs.text:
{
  "error": "invalid_request",
  "message": "Missing required field: message"
}

{
  "error": "unauthorized",
  "message": "Invalid API key provided"

  "error": "rate_limit_exceeded",

docs.title: 🧠 Handling Inappropriate Responses
docs.text:
In rare cases, the AI may return responses deemed inappropriate for your brand. We recommend :

  • Filtering sensitive content on your frontend
  • Reporting flagged messages to support for retraining
  • Using moderation settings (coming soon)

docs.title: 🔧 Best Practices
docs.text:
• Validate input fields before calling the API
  • Use try/catch or .catch() blocks to handle errors gracefully
  • Log errors for future diagnosis
  • Respect rate limit headers to prevent interruptions.

docs.title: API Usage Examples
docs.text: Here are code examples to help you quickly integrate the E-commerce Chatbot API into your applications.

docs.title: ▶️ JavaScript (Fetch)
docs.text:
fetch("https://api.ecommerce.com/api/v1/chat/send", {
  method: "POST",
  headers: {
    "Content-Type": "application/json",
    "Authorization": "Bearer YOUR_API_KEY"
  },
  body: JSON.stringify({
    message: "I want to return my order",
    user_id: "user_123",
    context: {
      order_id: "ORD-456",
      purchase_date: "2025-01-15"
    }
  })
})
  .then(response => response.json())
  .then(data => console.log(data));

docs.title: 🐍 Python (requests)
docs.text:
import requests

url = "https://api.ecommerce.com/api/v1/chat/send"
headers = {
    "Authorization": "Bearer YOUR_API_KEY",
    "Content-Type": "application/json"
}

    "message": "I want to return my order",
    "user_id": "user_123",
    "context": {
        "order_id": "ORD-456",
        "purchase_date": "2025-01-15"
    }
}

response = requests.post(url, json=payload, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

docs.title: Monitoring & Analytics
docs.text: Effective monitoring helps you track the health and performance of the E-commerce Chatbot API integration.

docs.title: 📊 Analytics Data
docs.text:
The /chat/analytics endpoint provides insights including :

  • Number of messages processed per day
  • Most common user queries
  • Average response time
  • Error rates (timeouts, inappropriate responses)

docs.title: 🔎 Sample Analytics Response
docs.text:
{
  "date": "2025-06-10",
  "total_messages": 1250,
  "most_common_queries": [
    "return order",
    "track shipment",
    "product recommendation"
  ],
  "average_response_time_ms": 150,
  "error_rate_percent": 0.5
}

docs.title: 📈 Best Practices
docs.text:
• Regularly poll /chat/analytics to monitor chatbot usage.
  • Set alerts on error rates exceeding thresholds.
  • Use analytics to identify trends and optimize chatbot responses.
  • Combine analytics with webhook events for real-time insights.

docs.title: ⚙️ Monitoring Tools Integration
docs.text:
You can integrate chatbot metrics into your existing monitoring dashboards using :

  • Prometheus & Grafana
  • Datadog
  • New Relic

via custom scripts that pull /chat/analytics data.

docs.title: Rate Limits & Best Practices
docs.text: To ensure fair usage and system stability, the E-commerce Chatbot API enforces rate limiting on all endpoints.

docs.title: ⏱️ Global Rate Limits
docs.text:
Endpoint Category Limit Window /chat/send 60 requests per minute per user /chat/history 100 requests per minute per user /chat/analytics 30 requests per minute per account

⚠️ If you exceed the limit, the API will return a 429 Too Many Requests response.

docs.title: 📦 Response on Limit Exceeded
docs.text:
{
  "error": {
    "code": 429,
    "message": "Rate limit exceeded. Try again later."
  }
}

docs.title: 🔄 Retry-After Header
docs.text:
When throttled, the response will include a Retry-After header indicating how many seconds to wait :

Retry-After: 30

docs.title: ✅ Best Practices
docs.text:
• Use exponential backoff when retrying failed requests.
  • Avoid loops or bulk calls without delays.
  • Cache frequent responses where possible.
  • Monitor rate limit headers returned by the API :
X-RateLimit-Limit: 60
X-RateLimit-Remaining: 0
X-RateLimit-Reset: 1718023980
  • Plan for spikes : if your app may exceed limits, contact support for higher quotas.

docs.title: 📌 Contact
docs.text: If your app requires a custom rate limit due to business needs, please reach out via the developer portal.

docs.title: Use Cases for the E-commerce Chatbot API
docs.text: This section describes common business scenarios where the chatbot API can improve customer experience and operational efficiency.

docs.title: 🛠️ Customer Support (SAV)
docs.text:
• Return Requests: Customers can initiate product returns by sending messages like "I want to return my order."
  • Order Status: The chatbot can track shipment status based on order ID and provide updates.
  • FAQ Handling: Common questions such as payment methods, delivery times, and product availability are answered instantly.

docs.title: 🎯 Product Recommendations
docs.text:
• The AI suggests personalized product recommendations based on user purchase history and preferences.
  • Example : A user asks, "What would you recommend for winter jackets ?", the chatbot returns relevant products dynamically.

docs.title: 📈 Analytics and Insights
docs.text:
• Track frequent user queries and identify common pain points.
  • Analyze chatbot effectiveness via customer feedback events.
  • Use data to optimize support workflows and improve bot responses.

docs.title: 💡 Implementation Tips
docs.text:
• Combine /chat/send and /chat/history endpoints to maintain conversation context.
  • Leverage webhook events to trigger actions in your CRM or ticketing system.
  • Use analytics to monitor performance and adapt chatbot training.

docs.title: 🔗 Related API Endpoints
docs.text:
• /chat/send — Send messages to the chatbot
  • /chat/history — Retrieve conversation history
  • /chat/analytics — Access usage statistics

docs.title: Webhooks
docs.text: Webhooks allow your system to receive real-time updates from the E-commerce Chatbot API when key events occur — such as new messages, analytics thresholds, or user interactions.

docs.title: 🔔 How It Works
docs.text:
1. You register a publicly accessible HTTPS endpoint.
  2. Our system sends a POST request to that URL when events occur.
  3. You validate the signature and process the payload.

docs.title: 📬 Example Payload
docs.text:
{
  "event": "chat.message.sent",
  "timestamp": "2025-06-10T14:23:00Z",
  "data": {
    "message_id": "msg_789",
    "user_id": "user_123",
    "text": "I need help with my order",
    "intent": "return_order"
  }
}

docs.title: 🧾 Supported Events
docs.text: Event Name Description chat.message.sent A user message has been processed by the AI chat.feedback.received A user gave feedback on the chatbot's response chat.alert.triggered Anomaly detected (e.g. inappropriate request)

docs.title: 🔐 Signature Validation
docs.text:
Each webhook request includes an -Signature header :

X-Signature: sha256=ab12c3d4ef567...

To verify :

  1. Compute an HMAC-SHA256 hash of the raw request body using your webhook secret.
  2. Compare it to the value in the X-Signature header.
  3. If they match, the payload is authentic.

docs.title: ⚠️ Error Handling & Retries
docs.text:
• We retry failed webhooks up to 3 times, with exponential backoff.
  • A 2xx HTTP response acknowledges successful delivery.
  • A 4xx or 5xx response triggers a retry.

docs.title: 📘 Tips
docs.text:
• Always respond quickly (under 3 seconds).
  • Use a queue or background worker to process data.
  • Keep webhook secrets safe and rotate periodically.

docs.title: 🛠️ Registering Your Webhook
docs.text:
To register a webhook endpoint, go to the developer dashboard and provide :

  • Public HTTPS URL
  • Events to subscribe to
  • Secret for signing requests

docs.title: GET /api/v1/chat/analytics
docs.text: Retrieve analytics data about chatbot usage and performance.

docs.text:
This endpoint requires an API key in the Authorization header:

Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

docs.title: 🧾 Query Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Required Description start_date string ❌ Start date for analytics (YYYY-MM-DD) end_date string ❌ End date for analytics (YYYY-MM-DD)

docs.title: 📤 Response

{
  "total_requests": 1250,
  "average_response_time_ms": 350,
  "error_rate": 0.02,
  "most_common_queries": [
    "return order",
    "track shipment",
    "product recommendation"
  ]

Field Type Description total_requests integer Total number of chat requests received average_response_time_ms integer Average response time in milliseconds error_rate float Proportion of failed requests (0 to 1) most_common_queries array List of most frequent user query phrases

docs.title: GET /api/v1/chat/history
docs.text: Retrieve the conversation history for a given user.

docs.title: 🔐 Authentication
docs.text:
This endpoint requires an API key in the Authorization header:

Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

docs.title: 🧾 Query Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Required Description user_id string ✅ Unique identifier of the user limit int ❌ Number of messages to retrieve (default: 20)

docs.title: 📤 Response
docs.text:
{
  "conversation_id": "conv_789",
  "messages": [
    {
      "sender": "user",
      "message": "I want to return my order",
      "timestamp": "2025-06-09T10:10:00Z"
    },
    {
      "sender": "assistant",
      "message": "Sure, I can help you return your order.",
      "timestamp": "2025-06-09T10:12:00Z"
    }
  ]
}
Field Type Description conversation_id string ID of the conversation messages array List of message objects

Each message object contains :

Field Type Description sender string Either "user" or "assistant" message string The text content of the message timestamp string ISO 8601 timestamp of the message
